V Budimpešti obsežna razstava del Rubensa in sodobnikov
01 Nov 2019, 16:58 by STA

V Muzeju likovnih umetnosti v Budimpešti je na ogled razstava Rubens, Van Dyck in lepota nizozemskega slikarstva. Združuje 120 del ter zlato dobo nizozemskega slikarstva predstavi z deli enega najpomembnejših evropskih baročnih slikarjev Petra Paula Rubensa in njegovih sodobnikov. Na ogled bo do 16. februarja prihodnje leto.



Rubensov avtoportret (1623) 

BUDIMPEŠTA > Razstava osvetljuje Rubensovega genija ter pripoveduje o vplivu njegove umetnosti. Poleg tega opozori na povezave med južno Nizozemsko in Madžarsko, pri katerih je imel ključno vlogo avstrijski nadvojvoda Leopold Wilhelm.
Po pisanju madžarske tiskovne agencije MTI je v razstavo vključenih tudi več kot deset slik flamskega slikarja Anthonisa van Dycka.
Glavni partner pri razstavi Muzej Liechtenstein na Dunaju je prispeval 20 slik, med njimi je slika iz Rubensovega monumentalnega cikla Decius Mus, in sicer Decius Mus pripoveduje svoje sanje.
Med deli na razstavi agencija MTI izpostavlja še Van Dyckov poročni portret Marie Henriette Stuart, ki ga je muzej v Budimpešti pridobil lani.
Ob slikah iz zbirke Muzeja likovnih umetnosti v Budimpešti so dela za razstavo med drugim posodili še Muzeji Louvre, Ermitaž in Prado ter nacionalni galeriji v Londonu in Washingtonu.

An extensive exhibition of works by Rubens and contemporaries in Budapest
01 Nov 2019, 15:58 by STA

The Museum of Fine Arts in Budapest has an exhibition of Rubens, Van Dyck and the beauty of Dutch painting. It combines 120 works and presents the golden age of Dutch painting with works by one of Europe's most important Baroque painters, Peter Paul Rubens and his contemporaries. It will be on view until February 16 next year.



Rubens's Self-Portrait (1623)

BUDAPEST> The exhibition sheds light on Rubens' genius and tells the impact of his art. It also draws attention to the links between the southern Netherlands and Hungary, in which Austrian Archduke Leopold Wilhelm played a key role.
According to the Hungarian news agency MTI, more than a dozen paintings by Flemish painter Anthonis van Dyck are included in the exhibition.
The main partner in the exhibition, the Liechtenstein Museum in Vienna, has contributed 20 paintings, including a painting from the Rubens monumental cycle Decius Mus, namely Decius Mus telling his dream.
Among his works at the exhibition, MTI also highlights Van Dyck's wedding portrait of Marie Henriette Stuart, which was acquired by the Budapest Museum last year.
In addition to the paintings from the collection of the Museum of Fine Arts in Budapest, the Louvre, Hermitage and Prado Museums and the National Galleries in London and Washington have lent their works to the exhibition.
